subject: Decisions and Verdicts
Accidents and Safety
lead_paragraph: A jury awarded $9.5 million yesterday to the family of the former Chicago Blackhawks star Keith Magnuson in a wrongful-death lawsuit against the former N.H.L. player Rob Ramage, whose drunken-driving accident killed Magnuson. Magnuson’s wife and two children filed the suit against Ramage and National Car Rentals of Canada.Magnuson was a passenger in the rental car driven by Ramage that was involved in a head-on collision in suburban Toronto as the men were returning from a funeral Dec. 15, 2003. Magnuson died at the scene. He was 56.Ramage was convicted in October in Ontario of impaired driving causing death and four other charges. He could get up to 15 years in prison when he is sentenced Jan. 17.
